attributes.action: Give the right to children to argue their case in schools
attributes.background: In schools, teachers have complete over-riding control over what children say. If they are falsely accused of doing something which they believe they have not done, or they do not believe they do not deserve a certain punishment, it is labelled as "talking back."
attributes.additional_details: This is a petition to allow children to be able to freely argue their case with a neutral member of staff present in order to make sure that they receive a fair sanction. I have witnessed cases of children not being listened to and having to email the teacher to be heard. Sign for your child's rights.

attributes.action: To have the 23rd June declared an official day of mourning.
attributes.background: To demonstrate to the people who voted us out of the European Union, that we do not consider the 23rd June a cause for celebration.
attributes.additional_details: To be taken out of the European Union is an extremely serious step with catastrophic consequences and there are at least 16 million people who agree with me.  We are not going to be forced to make this move without some form of protest at the least.

attributes.action: To form a UK sterling trade area
attributes.background:
The formation of a sterling trade area comprising England and Wales, an independent Scotland and a united Ireland has the 
 potential to resolve almost all issues of sovereignty, currency, trade agreements following the Brexit decision

attributes.action: Let EU immigrants know what the plans are regarding their future in the UK
attributes.background:
Millions of EU citizens have been working in the UK for many years, many children were born in the UK from EU citizens, and as such, see Britain as their home as they grew up here and were taught the same values as all other British Children.
What conditions can you provide for them after Brexit?
attributes.additional_details:
Let EU immigrants know what the plans are regarding their future in the UK - immediately and without delay!

These families are all currently experiencing uncertainty and fear. Let them know what they can expect from the Government and don't keep them in the dark. They didn't have the right to vote in the Referendum, but they do have the right to know what will happen to their families, workplaces, mortgages, student loans and education, as well as safety and welfare.

attributes.action: Continue a pro immigration policy and recognise the value migrants bring the UK
attributes.background: As part of the EU exit negotiations the UK government should seek a deal that will maintain the current rights of all EU citizens in the UK and that will keep the UK border open to economic migrants and refugees alike.
attributes.additional_details:
In addition the UK government should take steps to fully explain to the public the great benefits that migration brings to the UK.

A large number of people who voted to leave in the recent referendum will have done so as a rejection of the federalist agenda of the EU and in favour of national sovereignty and democracy. They did not vote for a rejection of migrants or as a vote to close our borders. As such there is no mandate for a anti immigration policy

attributes.action: HM Government to initiate talks to allow Scotland to remain in the E.U.
attributes.background: Greenland exited the E.U. (E.E.C) in 1985, while Denmark remained within the EU. On that basis, as it's the will of the Scottish people (via the Referendum of 23/06/16) to remain within the E.U,  both Holyrood and Westminster to discuss arrangements that will Scotland alone to remain in the E.U.
attributes.additional_details: Reference to the UK referendum of 23/06/16 confirms it is the will of the Scottish people to remain within the European Union. Scotland does not agree with England and Wales and is being dragged, against its sovereign will out of the European Union.

attributes.action: Delay submission of intent to leave the EU (Article 50) until there is a new PM
attributes.background: Following the result of the referendum to leave the EU & the subsequent resignation of the PM it would not be in the UK's best interests to rush the submission of our intention to leave until a new leadership is in place.  This must be delayed until at least October to maximise the two year period.
attributes.additional_details: There are reports of EU leaders and other member states wanting the UK to submit the intention to leave immediately and begin the two year notice / negotiation period.  Given the likely duration of a leadership contest and the current target of October 2016 this could result in a rushed process and damage the chances of getting the best possible exit for the UK.  This petition is to delay the submission until a new PM and cabinet are in place so they are able to negotiate without distraction.

attributes.action: All political parties to have equal say in negotiating terms of exit from the EU
attributes.background: The future of Britain after the Referendum is the single most important issue facing us today. Our prosperity, security and well-being, as well as that of the rest of Europe and beyond is too big a responsibility for one group of politicians and cannot be left solely to the current government.
attributes.additional_details: We are told that exit negotiations could take up to two years. Mr Cameron says it should be left until his successor is appointed after October 2016. This could mean that the earliest date for implementation would be October 2018; only 15 months before the next general election which may provide a change of government. Therefore the crucial first years after implementation should involve all parties.

attributes.action: British People who are EU nationals should allowed to vote for Parl. Elections.
attributes.background: All British People should be given an opportunity to vote and stand for parliamentary Elections, just as 53 Commonwealth citizens and Irish Nationals domicile in the UK can. Should a 2nd EU Referendum be invoked all the 27 EU Citizens domicile in the UK should be allowed to vote like Irish nationals
attributes.additional_details:
The rules for the Irish were framed during the last century.
All EU nationals resident in Great Britain can vote for all other elections in the UK.
These EU nationals resident in the UK were not given a right to vote even though they pay taxes. Some of them for decades.

attributes.action: Deputy Prime minister post alongside Primeminister & one of them must be a woman
attributes.background: According to 2011 census the UK population was estimated 31 million men and 32.2 million women. By a women in such a key post by law will bring equality and fairness in politics and businesses - women think, work and decide differently - having women's contribution will enhance government polices.
attributes.additional_details: Out of 650 MPs there are 191 women although their representation is improving, they are still often a long way from getting to the highest posts. Studies at Stanford US and University of Chicago have found that districts served by female legislators are at a distinct advantage over those represented by men. Women are actually more inclined towards more modern leadership, which is collaborative problem-solving, enabling, consultative, and not just trying to assert a kind of hierarchical power.

attributes.action: Set up a unity commission to negotiate the terms of Brexit.
attributes.background: Exceptional circumstances require an exceptional response. HM Government should set aside narrow party politics and set up a commission with the power to negotiate the terms of our exit. This must include representatives of all parties, all regions, all backgrounds, and many interest groups.
attributes.additional_details: The terms of Brexit are too important to leave to the interests of a narrow political group. A commission should be set up with the power to negotiate our exit. This would allow the nation to draw together politicians from all parties who polled more than 5% at the last general election. Members should also be appointed from business, education, unions, the law, charities, public services, security and the economy. The negotiated terms will be legally binding on the government of the day.

attributes.action: Allow the registration of 15 year olds, enabling them eligibility to vote at 16
attributes.background: Young people should be allowed to vote in all local and national elections and referendums. During the recent European referendum, an increasing amount of younger people were voicing frustration at not being allowed to take part in the democratic process.
attributes.additional_details: Younger people are becoming increasingly interested in politics at a local, national and global level. It seems unfair that people under 18 should be excluded from a process that has implications on their lives and shapes their long term future. I am calling on the UK parliament to extend the right to vote to all 16 year olds. While recently campaigning, talking to young people indicated to me that they are showing a real enthusiasm and interest in how politics affects their lives.

attributes.action: Delay the replacement of Trident till after the imminent Scottish referendum
attributes.background: We've all debated the strong moral and ethical case for the replacement of Britain's nuclear 'deterrent' program. However, following the UK's decision to exit the European Union on the June 23rd this year. There is now a stronger economical and political case to be made against its renewal.
attributes.additional_details: Following the UK's exit from the European Union and the massive decline in the value of the £, the cost of replacing Trident is expected to rise significantly from the Department of Defence's previous estimate of around £40 billion to £60-150 billion. Furthermore, Scotland's potential exit from the union means the current base of the nuclear 'deterrent' in Clyde may no longer be tenable. It is not right that we replace our nuclear weapons for status, a serious debate on this issue is required.

attributes.action: Give UK citizenship automatically to foreign parents of British children
attributes.background:
I am Hungarian, business owner, property owner, a UK resident, have 2 British children, born in the UK.
I want the government to give me and other parents a guarantee, that after leaving the EU, I will have the right to remain, with my family by giving citizenship to parents like me, automatically.

attributes.action: New government to reach an agreement on Free trade and Free movement with the EU
attributes.background:
The  EU  has been the UK's largest trade partner for years. It will be
devastating for our economy to not be able to enjoy free trade with
the  EU  as  a  whole, should the UK actually leave the EU in the near
future. Same goes for free movement of UK citizens in Europe
attributes.additional_details:
Now  that  the  UK  has  voted to leave the EU, I believe it is in the
common  interest  of  British people to have a comprehensive agreement with  the  EU  as  a  whole  rather than with each individual  country, agreement  that  would give us free trade and free movement, something we have so much enjoyed whilst being a part of the EU. EU has been our biggest  trade  partner (collectively) and will continue to be such in the future. This should become the #1 priority of the new UK government.

attributes.action: A new ONS prevalence survey into Children's and Young People's Mental Health.
attributes.background: Office of National Statistics prevalence surveys were carried out into Children and Young People's Mental Health in 1999 & 2004.  We have no equivalent up to date information.  There are indicators of a growing problem in the UK in this area.  A new survey would highlight the need for action.
attributes.additional_details:
House of Commons Health Committee, "Children's and Adolescent's mental health and CAMHS: Third Report of Session 2014-15", p17, http://www.publications.parliament.uk/pa/cm201415/cmselect/cmhealth/342/342.pdf
Chief Medical Officer, "Annual Report 2012: Our Children Deserve Better", ch10 p3, https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/255237/2901304_CMO_complete_low_res_accessible.pdf

attributes.action: Have a serious debate regarding Capital Punishment for murder
attributes.background: This is not a knee jerk reaction to the appalling events in Birstall yesterday but more a reaction to the ease with taking a life has become acceptable, Capital Punishment would hopefully make some people think twice before ending a person's life.
attributes.additional_details: The progress with DNA testing must make it unlikely any one innocent of a crime would be punished in erroras,  I know happened in the past.

attributes.action: Orgnanise a blockade of the Libyan coast to stop people trafficking.
attributes.background: Around 150,000 migrants travelled from Libya to Italy by boat last year and, so far this year, more than 37,000 people have been intercepted in the Mediterranean and taken to Italian ports. Hundreds are believed to have died after their overloaded vessels sank or capsized.
attributes.additional_details: Lord West, ex-First Sealord and Chief of Naval Staff, said such a measure would require 10 Navy frigates and destroyers, along with helicopters, drones and other intelligence and surveillance capability

attributes.action: Require the Government to immediately abolish tuition fees.
attributes.background: The current rate of interest charged by the Student Loan Company is currently eight times the current rate of inflation. Quite simply, the status quo will stifle this country's future prosperity by strangling our talent at birth.

attributes.action: Make solar renewable energy a government-led initiative
attributes.background: While it has been often argued that the United Kingdom is a leader in the field of renewable energy, this has primarily been accomplished by the actions of private British businesses and not the actions of the government. It is most certainly time for the government to take its place in the sun.
attributes.additional_details: It is our goal, as it should be the goal of every person both of and on these islands and elsewhere on this planet, to protect it for future generations. There is no doubt in the minds of scientists that a future including humans must be a future of renewable and clean energy. We therefore recommend that the government require all of its properties, and those owned by its representatives of the people of both the upper and lower chambers, to, within a period of five years, possess solar panels.

attributes.action: Apply diplomatic pressure to both Norway and Japan to cease killing Whales.
attributes.background: Norway kills around 500 Minke Whales annually and Japan continues to defy International agreements citing scientific research as an excuse to hunt and kill whales. The most efficient killing methods leave about 20% of whales alive after the first strike, allowing untold agony and lingering death.

attributes.action: Stop calling the new minimum wage the 'National Living Wage'.
attributes.background: The Living Wage Foundation defines the living wage as £8.25 per hour for the UK as a whole, or £9.40 in London.  While we are glad that the minimum wage has been increased to £7.20, this is not the living wage.  As such, it should be called the Minimum Wage, NOT the 'National Living Wage'.

attributes.action: Parliament to debate: "It's wrong for UK to remain in democratic deficient EU."
attributes.background: Given that the UK has a centuries long tradition of democratic checks and balances and the EU has severe and structural democratic deficiencies it would be wrong for the UK to remain in the EU as to remain in the EU reduces the democratic means of accountability to the British People:
attributes.additional_details:
The key severe democratic deficiencies of the EU are as follows:

The EU has Four Presidents and NON are Elected
The EU Parliament CANNOT start new or get rid of existing EU Laws nor allow for Private Members or Private Bills
The EU Government (the EU Commission) is NOT Elected is not accountable to us & we CANNOT remove/change it
The EU does not form law in PUBLIC and does not enable people to take part in forming it or accountable public debate on EU law
The EU IS  DEMOCRATICALLY DEFICIENT

attributes.action: Make access to mains gas a legal right for all homes and properties in the UK.
attributes.background: Many families can't access mains gas & are forced to use more expensive forms of fuel for cooking and heating. The gas network often expands when new homes are built close to the existing network, however whole communities have been left behind because they are off grid, often only by a few miles.
attributes.additional_details: Mains gas delivered via a pipeline would instantly remove the damage to the environment caused by the hundreds of millions of carbon related miles from delivery trucks polluting our towns and villages each and every year whilst travelling back and forth delivering alternative expensive fuels such as LPG and oil to off grid homes. These journeys will never stop, there is no alternative. Over 1 million properties many with children and older occupants have no access to mains gas. Thats just wrong.

attributes.action: Ban door-to-door fundraising by large charities (so called 'doorstep chuggers')
attributes.background: This method of fundraising can be intrusive and where high pressure tactics are used by the fundraisers (who may in cases be remunerated based on the level of donation commitments they secure), can potentially put elderly or vulnerable persons in a position where they are taken advantage of.
attributes.additional_details: Our view is that attempts to regulate this form of fundraising activity seem ineffective and as such our petition is for an outright ban to make the position clearer on what is and is not allowed.

attributes.action: Make it Illegal to ignore the "No Junk Mail" and "No Callers" Door signs
attributes.background: The "Junk Mail" and "No Callers"  signs are placed on doors by residents in an attempt to stop the need to deal with this menace. But because there is no legal requirement, the wishes of these residents are ignored, and the rights of the residents to not be harassed in their own home are violated.
attributes.additional_details: This type of law is already in place in countries like Australia, and USA

attributes.action: Prevent the exclusion of primary school children due to their haircuts.
attributes.background: A Birmingham primary school pupil was suspended from his school because his haircut 'wasn't suitable for their school policy' despite looking very smart. If a child has a smart, socially acceptable haircut, they should be allowed to wear it without harassment from their school.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-birmingham-36269041

attributes.action: Stop taxing and means testing veterans service pensions
attributes.background: Veterans are not benefing from their service pensions due to taxation and means testing .

attributes.action: Create a NHS and Care Commission to review and manage all health care in the UK.
attributes.background: The 21st C has brought new challenges to the health and care provision which underpins the well being of all in the UK. It is timely to review the NHS to ensure that it meets modern needs but retains the ethos of equality of services and  provision, free at point of delivery.

attributes.action: Change the tax system so student loan repayments are taken before income tax.
attributes.background: Most students can not use their income tax allowance whilst studying at university and rely on borrowing money from the students loan company to cover living expenses. Therefore, repayments of this student debt should be exempt from income tax.
attributes.additional_details:
These changes would bring the following benefits:

1. Earlier repayment and reduced pressure of student debt
2. A fairer systems for those starting out in life
3. Additional encouragement for further education

attributes.action: Offer a free workshop on healthy eating on a budget to all UK residents
attributes.background: Myth; 'eating healthily is more expensive than buying junk food'. Pre-packed food or pre-prepared food can be much more expensive and full of sugars, fats and preservatives than making from scratch. More education is needed to make healthy shopping choices, ultimately improving the nation's health.
attributes.additional_details:
If people are educated on how to read the supermarket price labels of fruit and veg for instance, quite often it is cheaper to buy loose vegetables than it is to buy pre-packed. Educate on how simple healthy meals can be made with very few cheap ingredients. e.g.

Vegetarian tomato pasta dish; home-made total price for a family of 4; £0.89.

If wanting to add meat (Beef mince as an addition) ; Total price £2.89 for 4 servings.

Alternative pre-packed pre-made product, 4 servings; £6.60.

attributes.action: Legalise muskets, cannons and swords for self defence
attributes.background: Similar to the second amendment in the US, muskets, swords and cannons can be possessed if a relevant licence is held (level 1 for a sword, level 2 for a musket and 3 for a cannon)the weapons cannot be concealed.Also create a body to monitor gun owners and distribute licences.

attributes.action: All new trees planted on Government owned land should be fruit trees
attributes.background: All new trees on Government owned land should be fruit trees and the produce of those trees should be made freely available to members of the public

attributes.action: Call on the government to publicly confirm support for strong encryption.
attributes.background: The government should not erode the security of our devices or applications, pressure companies to keep and allow government access to our data, mandate implementation of vulnerabilities or backdoors into products or have disproportionate access to the keys to  our private data.
attributes.additional_details:
The public demands privacy, security, and integrity for their communications and devices. As a public, we should be confident that the services we use haven’t been weakened or compromised by government mandate or pressure. No legislation or private agreement with the government should undermine our rights.

Weakening encryption weakens the entire Internet. Endorse strong encryption and encourage other world governments to do the same.

attributes.action: Stop the reassessment and resultant refusal of blue badges to disabled people
attributes.background:
A GOVERNMENT SHOULD BE JUDGED UPON HOW IT TREATS ITS LEAST FORTUNATE CITIZENS 
We are in a period of time where disabled people all across the country are being re-assessed for their needs, including their access to a blue badge. Please put a stop to the 1000s of disabled people losing them unjust.
attributes.additional_details: Not only is this reassessment traumatic enough for disabled people, with the potential consequence of losing their ability to confidently leave the house, assessors are in a position where they have to justify their performance through means of denying access to a certain number of people, thus looking to deny future access to a blue badge wherever they see fit. Recently, a family member who cannot walk 50 feet was told her blue badge is being revoked, due to 'evidence' that they can walk fine.

attributes.action: Bring back Corporal Punishment for heinous crimes, e.g. Murder & Rape
attributes.background: Prison terms are too lenient in the UK and I think only way to deter people committing heinous crimes is to bring back Corporal Punishment

attributes.action: Let children go on holiday when they like & keep schools open 253 days a year.
attributes.background: Many families are priced out of holidays because traditional school holidays cause peaks in demand. If schools are open all year round families can synchronise their holiday to suit their work commitments. Schools can then arrange catch up lessons for children who have been on holiday.
attributes.additional_details:
Long summer holidays disrupt children`s education and inhibit learning.

The economy of the country would benefit as families would not have to rely on expensive holiday child care.

Industry would benefit from parents not having to take time off work due to child care commitments.

Children will receive more education creating a better educated society.

Parents will avoid being fined for taking children out of school.

More full time jobs would be created rather than seasonal employment.

attributes.action: Allow voters to choose to rerun an election if a plurality wish it.
attributes.background: It's clear from the turnout at elections that voters are disenchanted with politics.  Many claim they dislike all candidates. All ballot papers should have an option for None of the above (NOTA). If NOTA gets more votes than any candidate, that area's election should be rerun with new candidates.
attributes.additional_details: Voter turnout in the UK has been on a long-term downward trend.  Before 2000, national elections typically attracted over 70% turnout (see http://www.ukpolitical.info/Turnout45.htm) and 80% in the early 1950s.  Since 2000, general election turnout has been below 70%.  In addition, the ability to reject a slate of candidates would address or ease many of the issues identified in the Parliamentary report here: http://www.publications.parliament.uk/pa/cm201415/cmselect/cmpolcon/232/23205.htm

attributes.action: Stop landlords from discriminating against young people
attributes.background: Landlords legally have the right to disallow young people usually 18-24 from renting their properties. Most use the stereotypical excuse of "they just want to party" or "they wreck the place" I myself have become homeless due to this and discrimination against any characteristic should be banned.

attributes.action: force absent parents to see their children
attributes.background: absent parents put their needs first before their children,force the absent parent to see their children after all children are a lifetime commitment for both parents.children need a relationship with mum and dad through out their childhood.

attributes.action: Reopen the maternity ward in Crawley Hospital
attributes.background: East surrey hospital and worthing hospital is a long way to go for ladies in labour in the Crawley/Horsham area.

attributes.action: Form an elite squadron of special forces within the G8 to execute all IS members
attributes.background: With the recent atrocities in France and Belgium the world needs to eradicate IS. Action needs to be done to stop these murderers. I propose the G8 countries establish an elite special forces to execute all known IS members on the recent list of 2000+ members from the intelligence found last month.
attributes.additional_details: Members of IS need to be wiped out. They should lose their human rights when they sign up. Too many innocent people from all over the world are losing their lives and bringing fear to millions because of idiotic beliefs which have no right in this world. The only way to deal with these brain washed murderers is to eradicate them.

attributes.action: Scrap the proposed Sugar Tax levy
attributes.background: This newly proposed Sugar Tax levy on the drinks giants is nothing more than, yet another in-direct taxation on the lower paid working class public.
attributes.additional_details:
If the government wishes to raise additional funds for the NHS, due to obese people putting additional pressure on the service, then the government should also place additional taxation on all the fitness fanatics, of whom cost the NHS millions each year in joint replacements, muscle and ligament rebuilds.

Other countries have tried to implement the same levy and have proved that it had little to no effect on the rates of obesity. 

Let’s get this crazy tax levy scrapped before it’s started.

attributes.action: Introduce nutrition, the law and tax system in to the primary curriculum
attributes.background:
Many people don't appear to have enough understanding of nutrition, law and taxes.
With introducing or further implimenting these subjects in to the classroom we can help combat the increasing health epidemic, reduce overall debt, and help reduce the chances of incarceration from an early age.

attributes.action: Raise the minium wage to £10ph a realistic living standard to not get into debt
attributes.background: The basic minimum wage is a unreasonable income to live off of especially having the responsibility of a child/ children. It is a big struggle for many working class parents/ people to make do in the society we live in to actually live off of the basic wage provided. Many people have got into debt.
attributes.additional_details: My own personal experience of getting into debt due to having to change jobs because of unsuitability, not earning enough income and then having to rely back on benefits to support myself and family showed me that wages need to be reasonable to actually live on. I have been unable to save for many years which I want to do and have been struggling to provide for my family/ myself due to the lack of suitable available work. I believe people with a stable income and career benefit our economy.

attributes.action: Delay the referendum on EU in/out until such time as the public can be educated
attributes.background: Leaving,  or remaining within, the EU is a huge decision with far reaching implications. As yet, a satisfactory, objective method of educating the decisions makers (the public) on the facts has yet to be discovered.  More time is needed to lay out the case, so the public can decide, based on facts.
attributes.additional_details:
Popular media channels are awash with the public pleading with so called subject matter experts to present objective facts to add credibility to the either the 'in' or 'out' campaigns. 

We propose that the referendum be delayed until such time that both cases can be presented fairly and properly to the public.

attributes.action: End the supply of alcoholic drinks to MP's / Peers in the Palace of Westminster.
attributes.background:
MP's and Peers are able to purchase alcoholic drinks at a subsidized price at bars in the palace of Westminster costing the tax payer over £4million per year.
As a place of work Westminster should be kept dry with provision of food and soft drinks only. our MPs should vote with a clear head.

attributes.action: Allow parents with a court order to be helped by local authorities with housing
attributes.background: Local authorities will only deem the person who receives child benefit to be entitled to any help with housing even when there is a court order in place stating children are to live with the other parent for half the week which is unfair and leaves so many parents in financial difficulty

attributes.action: Make it illegal to park on or in front of a dropped kerb and private driveways.
attributes.background: Current high way code rules recommend that people do not block private driveways. As this is not an illegal action, people suffer the consequences of irresponsible parking by others. The move to make this action illegal and therefore give the police power to discourage problems.

attributes.action: Introduce mandatory driving licence re-testing for old age pensioners
attributes.background:
It has been shown numerous times that old age causes lowered reflexes and reaction times. This has been reflected in the high level of accidents and poor driving from pensioners.

To maintain the standards of driving on UK roads, I propose mandatory re-testing above a certain age (perhaps ~70).
attributes.additional_details:
Here's is the most recent example of many: 

"Eight car pile-up after elderly driver goes wrong way down motorway"

http://metro.co.uk/2016/08/31/eight-car-pile-up-after-elderly-driver-goes-wrong-way-down-motorway-6101485/#ixzz4IzPn56B6

Studies suggest that older drivers are no more dangerous than young drivers, but it is scientifically certain that old age results in degradation of the senses. As such, it stands to reason that there is a point when driving is no longer a safe endeavour.
